str2: Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From meros; to part, i.e. to apportion, bestow, share, or to disunite, differ.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
